Storageapp functionality¶

Storageapp’s models¶

This module contains the models for the storageapp app.

class storageapp.models.FileTypes(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

This class represents the file types model.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

The save function is a built-in function that saves the image to the database. The super() function allows us to access methods from parent class, in this case, the save method of the Model class. The img variable opens up our image file and stores it as an Image object. We then check if either height or width of our image is greater than 100 pixels and if so we resize it using thumbnail() method which takes a tuple as an argument with new dimensions for our resized image.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of the class

  • args – Send a non-keyworded variable length argument list to the function

  • kwargs – Pass keyworded, variable-length argument list to a function

Returns:

The save method of the super class

Doc-author:

Trelent

classmethod get_fields_list()¶

The get_fields_list function returns a dictionary of the form {num: field.name} for each field in the model, where num is an integer and field.name is a string representing the name of that particular model’s fields.

Parameters:

cls – Pass in the class that is being used to call this function

Returns:

A dictionary with the field number as key and the field name as value

Doc-author:

Trelent

Storageapp’s forms¶

This module contains the forms for the storageapp.

But for now, there are no forms in this app.

Storageapp’s urls¶

This module contains all the urls for the storageapp app.

This module can contain tests for the storageapp.

But for now, there are no tests.

Storageapp’s services¶

This module contains the FileServices class.

class storageapp.services.file_services.FileServices¶

This class contains methods for working with files.

dbx_storage = <storages.backends.dropbox.DropBoxStorage object>¶
classmethod delete_file(file)¶

The delete_file function takes a file object as an argument and deletes it from the database. It also deletes the file from Dropbox, using the dropbox_file_name attribute of that object.

Parameters:

  • cls – Specify the class that is being used to call the function

  • file – Identify the file to be deleted

Returns:

The string ‘file deleted’

Doc-author:

Trelent

classmethod download_file(file)¶
The download_file function takes a file object as an argument and returns the url of that file.

The function uses the dropbox_storage class to get the url of a given file.

Parameters:

  • cls – Pass the class to a method

  • file – Find the file in the database

Returns:

The url of the file

Doc-author:

Trelent

classmethod get_file_info(request)¶

The get_file_info function is a class method that takes in the request object and returns the owner instance, type instance, extension instance and file name. The function first gets the file from the request object. It then gets the user id from the request user to get an owner instance of that user. Next it checks if there is a value for ‘user_input’ in POST data which would be the case when renaming files or folders (see rename_file()). If there is no value for ‘user_input’, then we use the original file name as our file name variable. We also check if

Parameters:

  • cls – Pass the class of the model to be created

  • request – Get the file from the request

Returns:

A tuple with the following information:

Doc-author:

Trelent

reg_ex_existance = '\\.[^./\\\\]+$'¶
static render_files_list(request, files_list=None, message='This is your files.')¶

The render_files_list function is used to render the files_list.html template, which displays a list of all files belonging to the user who is currently logged in. The function takes two arguments: request and files_list, which are both required for rendering the template. The optional message argument can be used to display a custom message on top of the page.

Parameters:

  • request – Pass the request object to the function

  • files_list – Pass the list of files to be displayed

  • message – Pass a message to the user

Returns:

A rendered template with the context

Doc-author:

Trelent

classmethod save_file_dropbox_and_get_new_name(request)¶

The save_file_dropbox_and_get_new_name function saves a file to Dropbox and returns the new name of the file.

Parameters:

  • cls – Refer to the class that is being used

  • request – Get the file from the request

Returns:

The name of the file that was saved to dropbox

Doc-author:

Trelent

This module is used to create tables in the database.

storageapp.services.create_tables.create_tables()¶

The create_tables function creates the tables in the database. It is called by manage.py when you run python manage.py create_storageapp_tables

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

Storageapp’s management commands¶

This module contains command for create files types and files extensions in FileExtension and FileTypes tables from storageapp

class storageapp.management.commands.create_storageapp_tables.Command(stdout=None, stderr=None, no_color=False, force_color=False)¶

This class contains command for create files types and files extensions in FileExtension and FileTypes tables from storageapp

handle(*args, **options)¶

The handle function is the entry point for a Django management command. It’s called by the manage.py script when you run python manage.py &lt;command&gt; from your project directory.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • args – Pass a variable number of arguments to a function

  • options – Pass in the options that are passed to the command

Returns:

A string that is printed in the console

Doc-author:

Trelent
